long_desc.thetext: I've done some initial work on this that I can share with you if you like but the patch changes are significant. I'm also not sure if the new Terry Pratchett content is acceptable to include.

This bug appears to have been reported against 'rawhide' during the Fedora 24 development cycle. Changing version to '24'.
More information and reason for this action is here: https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/Fedora_Program_Management/HouseKeeping/Fedora24#Rawhide_Rebase
*** Bug 1394598 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
There's also a maintainer request in pkgdb: https://admin.fedoraproject.org/pkgdb/package/rpms/nethack/

Aloha-
Just curious if anyone is looking into this; 3.6.0 has been out for awhile now.
Hey, was just wondering if there's been any movement on this.

I've opened the maintainer request months ago with no reply. I've just sent an email to lmacken at the only address I can find (same of this bug request). If I'll not receive any response, I'll escalate as for the nonresponsive packages maintainers policy.

To be clear, I'm following the policy outlined at https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/Policy_for_nonresponsive_package_maintainers. I have a 3.6.0 update ready to go and will volunteer to take over maintenance of this package going forward.
If you want the changes committed sooner, I'm not just a NetHack player, I'm a provenpackager. So. That. :)

(In reply to Fabio Alessandro Locati from comment #7) > I've opened the maintainer request months ago with no reply. I've just sent > an email to lmacken at the only address I can find (same of this bug > request). If I'll not receive any response, I'll escalate as for the > nonresponsive packages maintainers policy.
Sorry, I haven't been paying too much attention to email lately. I approved your maintainer requests in the pkgdb.
@Ron: If you open a permission request at https://admin.fedoraproject.org/pkgdb/package/rpms/nethack/ I'll approve it ;)
Ping. Where are we at here? I'd like to play 3.6.0. :)
I'm going to see if I can get maintainer status on this package; I've been playing 3.6 on my Fedora 25 machine, but installed as a local RPM. :\
Thanks! And if that gets stalled, I'm a provenpackager and could commit your changes for you if you like.

http://mo.morsi.org/blog/node/398
:)
?
:)

This is my repository that I put all the changes in; Koji was able to build it fine:
https://github.com/tachoknight/nethack-rpm
I'm going to post on the mailing list about becoming the package maintainer.
Cool, let me know if that stalls or if you want me to commit this.
nethack-3.6.0-36.fc26 has been submitted as an update to Fedora 26. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2017-9cdc787dc9
nethack-3.6.0-36.fc25 has been submitted as an update to Fedora 25. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2017-4611029934

nethack-3.6.0-36.fc26 has been pushed to the Fedora 26 testing repository. If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report. See https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/QA:Updates_Testing for instructions on how to install test updates. Pushed to stable for F26, F25, and F24. Remember to ascend before updating as save and bones files from the previous version won't be loaded by the new version.
nethack-3.6.0-36.fc25 has been pushed to the Fedora 25 stable repository. If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.
